intro: Anthyllis albana var. macedonica, commonly known as the Macedonian whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in dense spike-like clusters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands.
